bibl.title: Photograph of a panorama of Havana, Cuba, including Caballerio Wharf, La Fuerza, Palace Presidential, and Maestranza Building, June 1908

div1.p: Photo by U.S. Army Signal Corps

div1.head: Photograph of a panorama of Havana, Cuba, including Caballerio Wharf, La Fuerza, Palace Presidential, and Maestranza Building, June 1908
div1.p:
NO objection to reproducing or publishing
this picture provided credit line
"PHOTO BY U.S. ARMY SIGNAL CORPS"
appears on the photograph or page,
except that permission must be obtained
from the War Department if it is desired
for use in commercial advertising.

Note the old cathedral tower
down the street on its rt

The Maestranza was used by the
U S Army as offices and
officers barracks. & officers mess.
A succession of chief Quartermasters
or clerks got sick here

Capt Cook got sick here,
died 25 Nov.

SC 113478
Cuban Pacification about 1908. View of right
side of harbor from boat. 1-North end Cabal-
lerio Wharf. 2-La Fuezza fort. 3-Palace
Presidential. 4-Maestranza Bldg., Havana, Cuba, June 1908.

gorgas had his office lived in the maestranza (originally an arsenal)
as chief sanitary officer 2nd floor (ie 3rd floor) in the fall of
1900
2 or 3 people had YF here in unclear
